NDIS Business Development Lead

Company Name Darebin City Council Company Location Preston, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description



Position No: F61150Salary: $81,421 per annum Permanent, Full-timeRDO arrangement negotiable
Applications Close: Monday 3 September 2018 at noon Contact: Gillian Damonze on 8470 8339
To support the continued growth of the local National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) market, we are seeking a passionate Business Development Lead to leverage off the strengths of current services, and identify new opportunities, for Council and local business to participate in the scheme.
The NDIS Business Development Lead will maintain current knowledge of NDIS requirements and provide advice and education to Council staff and local business in relation to the NDIS, to achieve greater engagement with, and inclusion of, NDIS participants and people with disability.
The role will also support the implementation of the Darebin Disability Access and Inclusion Plan to promote and embed concepts of access and inclusion; increasing the availability of a range of inclusive services and opportunities, to support people living with a disability in Darebin to exercise greater choice and control.
The successful applicant will enjoy working collaboratively, demonstrate sound communication skills and team work, and be responsible for providing excellent customer service to internal and external stakeholders.
The successful applicant will possess:
  • Tertiary qualifications in business, health, disability or related area, with demonstrable experience in business are essential or lesser formal qualifications with substantial relevant experience.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS)
  • Experience in business development, including a proven track-record of influencing change
  • Well-developed communication and engagement skills that foster a workplace culture of high professional standards and conduct
    If you think you will enjoy the challenges and opportunities this role has to offer, we encourage you to apply.

    Apply online at www.darebin.vic.gov.au or forward hard copy applications to: Manager People and Development, Darebin City Council, PO Box 91, PRESTON VIC 3072.
    Applications that do not address the Key Selection Criteria as detailed in the position description will not be considered. Darebin City Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in its selection and employment practices on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organisation, or other non-merit factors. We are committed to providing a safe working environment that embraces and values child safety, and thorough ‘Safety Screening’ processes apply.

841578952:
[

Junior Graphic Designer - 6 month fixed term contract

Company Name Cricket Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 23 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Cricket Victoria is one of Victoria’s leading sporting organisations. Cricket Victoria is the governing body for the game of cricket in Victoria. From grassroots cricket to the elite teams – the Melbourne Stars, Melbourne Renegades, Victorian Men’s Cricket Team and Victorian Women’s Cricket Team – Cricket Victoria nurtures and promotes the development and success of the sport for all Victorians.

Cricket Victoria is currently seeking an enthusiastic Junior Graphic Designer to work in our internal design team on a 6 month full time contract basis across the 2018-19 cricket season. This role will assist in the production of exciting design collateral for both the Melbourne Stars and Melbourne Renegades Big Bash League teams, and for Cricket Victoria and its programs.

Specifically, The Position Will Be Responsible For
  • Assisting the Graphic Designer with all internal design work for Melbourne Stars, Melbourne Renegades and Cricket Victoria, including but not limited to:
    • Designing large booklets for both print and web publication
    • Designing sponsorship proposals, posters, flyers, invites etc.
    • Designing eDM/website/social media artwork (including digital advertisements)
    • Designing artwork for use at events and at matches
    • Retouching/reworking of photography
  • Coordinating jobs and liaising effectively with stakeholders, other team members and printers
  • Assisting in the management and updating of the graphic design team project management system
We’re looking for applicants that:
  • Have strong skills using Adobe InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Have an advanced knowledge of working on the MAC environment
  • Strong ability to follow and maintain brand guidelines
  • Can maintain design consistency across all projects
  • Have a good understanding of layout design, typography, colour and imagery
  • Have knowledge of the print production process
  • Ability to work across multiple departments and manage multiple stakeholders
  • Strong attention to detail, and a culture of working to tight deadlines
  • Hold a tertiary degree/qualification in Graphic Design, Visual Communication or equivalent
  • Have a passion for working in sports and/or cricket!
We’re open to applicants with 1-2+ years experience, who have recently graduated, or are on the final year of their design studies who could transition into this role.

Why Cricket Victoria?
  • It’s an opportunity for you to combine one of your passions with your career. Everyone deserves to wake up excited to go to work!
  • It’s an exciting time to be involved in Cricket, the Big Bash League (BBL) and Women’s Big Bash League (WBBL) is growing, numbers in junior participation, women’s cricket, all abilities cricket and multicultural cricket is continuously increasing.
  • It’s an even more exciting time to be involved with Cricket Victoria, we’re just moved to our new home at Junction Oval – the CitiPower Centre.
  • We provide an exciting, dynamic working environment within the sports and entertainment industry.
  • We nurture a strong family culture – we’re one big cohesive working group.
  • We understand life is busy and encourage a work life balance so we offer flexible working arrangements.
  • Not only is the salary package attractive, we have extensive staff benefits including tickets and passes to sporting events (yes, including the cricket), gym access, salary packaging, workplace banking, corporate health insurance, discounts with corporate partners and the list goes on, it’s too long to go on…
Is this the opportunity you’ve been looking for?

If You Think You Are Ready To Launch Into a New Career Within a Professional And Passionate Environment, Please Apply Below With
  • A cover letter
  • Your resume
  • A strong portfolio of previous work, across both print and digital
Applications close Sunday 19 August 2018 at 11.00pm.

If you have any questions you’d like to ask prior to submitting your application, please email recruitment@cricketvictoria.com.au

At Cricket Victoria, we embrace diversity in gender, age, ethnicity, disability, religion and sexual orientation. We are committed to providing a safe environment for children across Australian Cricket, and we also offer a flexible work environment for employees. We measure ourselves on our behaviours – “How We Play”; our people value being real, smashing the boundaries, making every ball count and being stronger together.

Seniority Level

Entry level

Industry

  • Sports
  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Health, Wellness and Fitness

Employment Type

Contract

Job Functions

  • Design
  • Art/Creative
  • Information Technology

Job description

PERSONAL CARE ASSISTANT (PCA)
ARCARE CAULFIELD, VICTORIA

Permanent Part Time Vacancies Available

Ref: 17164

Exciting opportunities exist for compassionate Personal Care Assistants to join the team at our five star Residence- Arcare Caulfield!

Specifically, We Are Seeking Employees To Work

  • Monday to Friday (07:00 - 11:00) - Must be available to work the 5 days every week.

  • Thursday to Sunday (07:00 - 11:00) - Must be available to work the 4 days every week

  • Please indicate in your CV which of the above shifts you are interested in

    • About Arcare

    With our first aged care residence constructed in 1997, Arcare is the largest private residential aged care provider in Australia. We currently have over 35 residences throughout Victoria, NSW and Queensland.

    Beyond the luxurious surroundings of our residences, our residents are supported by our innovative relationships first approach to celebrating and supporting old age. This approach is driven by our Arcare values of Relationships, Uniqueness, Partnerships and Flexibility.

    The value and importance of relationships in all of our clients’ lives led to the development of our Dedicated Staff Assignment model, an approach which completely transforms the way that care and support are provided. Our internationally renowned Dedicated Staff Assignment sees team members working with the same small number of residents every day. This continuity allows for deep and trusting relationships to develop between residents, employees and families; and this is what makes Arcare a recognised leader in resident care globally.

    About The Opportunity

    As the Personal Care Assistant, you will be responsible for providing quality personal, social and emotional care and support to our Residents and their representatives in accordance with Arcare’s values. Successful applicants must have a Certificate III in Individual Support/Aged Care or equivalent.

    The successful applicant must possess the following;
    • Have a genuine interest in and respect for the unique personality, history and values of our Residents
    • Display a relationship centred approach to care
    • Possess a compassionate, caring and supportive nature
    • Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills
    • Provide five-star customer service
    • Team player
    • Computer proficient

    In return for your commitment to us and our Residents, we will provide you with flexibility, on the job training and excellent employment conditions.

    If you think you have what it takes to join our team at Arcare, please click ‘Apply Now’ or visit our website at -www.arcare.com.au/careers

    Applications close 24 August 2018

    Due to the high volume of recruitment, only successful candidates will be contacted

    All applicants are required to undergo a National Police Record Check.

    • Staffing and Recruiting

Marketing & Communications Coordinator

Company Name Calvary Community Company Location Mount Waverley, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 9 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About The Role

Reporting to the Senior Marketing & Communications Coordinator you’ll be responsible for delivering marketing and communication projects across Community Care, working with various stakeholders to deliver exceptional results across traditional and digital channels. With a disciplined approach to process and the ability to trouble-shoot, you’ll be a quick-thinking, problem solver responsible for:
  • Creative and compelling content to boost engagement and promote our brand to a variety of audiences
  • Social media strategies that demonstrates an understanding of SEO principles and emerging digital trends
  • Monitoring engagement across all platforms and reporting on metrics
  • Delivering a range of events and reporting on impact and outcomes
What you bring
  • Outstanding writing ability, including being able to take complex information and make it easy to understand
  • Experience working across all marketing and advertising channels
  • Ability to understand and report on outcomes and be able to change approach swiftly and easily
  • Ability to take a piece of content, or an idea, and look at different ways to use it across multiple channels
  • Experience with CRM systems and EDM strategies
  • A desire to join a team committed to the care of others in a mission based organisation
Benefits

This is an excellent opportunity to be a part of a leading mission based health care organisation. We offer paid parental leave, salary packaging, career progression, flexible working hours and training and skills development. Calvary is also proud to be recognised as a leader in gender equality. To find out more about the benefits of working at Calvary, please visit – https://www.calvarycare.org.au/careers/benefits/

About Calvary

Calvary is a national Catholic provider of health, community and aged care services operating in six states and territories. Our services include public and private hospital care, acute and sub-acute care, home care services and retirement and aged care services, in both rural and metropolitan areas. Calvary employs over 11,000 people and has over 1,500 volunteers.

Calvary continues the mission of the Sisters of the Little Company of Mary, a mission focused on communicating the inestimable dignity and value of each person. We express our values of hospitality, healing, stewardship and respect through “being for others” exemplified by the Calvary Spirit and the example of Venerable Mary Potter.

This role presents an opportunity to join the Community Care arm of Calvary. We are a progressive and friendly company that has been providing a range of flexible services to support people to live independently in their own homes and the community for over 25 years.
